news.title: Paramount Skydance launches hostile bid for WBD 'to finish what we started,' CEO Ellison tells CNBC
news.description: Netflix won a bidding war for the Warner Bros. film studio and HBO Max streaming service, but it doesn't plan to buy WBD's TV networks.

news.title: Pressure builds on Apple and CEO Tim Cook with holiday executive shake-up
news.description: Apple has seen extraordinary turnover in its top ranks over just the past week.

news.title: Former Trump lawyer Alina Habba resigns as New Jersey U.S. Attorney after disqualification
news.description: Alina Habba previously served as a defense lawyer for President Donald Trump, before being tapped to become the top federal prosecutor in New Jersey.

news.title: Trump announces $12 billion aid package for farmers caught up in trade war
news.description: President Donald Trump has imposed shifting tariff policies on most countries, while pushing to reshape relationships with China and other major trade partners.

news.title: Three more Wall Street firms came out with bullish 2026 outlooks. Here's why they see another upbeat year ahead
news.description: The S&P 500 could rise anywhere from another 9% to 18% by the end of 2026, according to three more Wall Street brokerages' latest forecasts.

news.title: S&P 500 slides as investors tap brakes before Fed decision this week: Live updates
news.description: The three major indexes are coming off their second straight winning weeks.

news.title: Powerful 7.6-magnitude earthquake strikes Japan's northeast
news.description: A powerful 7.6-magnitude earthquake shook northeastern Japan late on Monday, prompting tsunami warnings and orders for about 90,000 residents to evacuate.

news.title: Trump says Zelenskyy 'hasn't read U.S. peace proposal' as tensions mount
news.description: Tensions appear to be mounting once again between U.S. President Donald Trump and President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

news.title: European markets fall slightly as markets await Fed decision
news.description: European stocks fell slightly on Monday as global investors focused on the U.S. Federal Reserve's monetary policy decision.

news.title: How Ray Dalio would play the markets if he was still running Bridgewater
news.description: Speaking to CNBC's Dan Murphy, Ray Dalio broke down what his portfolio would look like.

news.title: McDonald’s will assess if franchisees are offering value for customers under new standards
news.description: McDonald's has leaned into value to appeal to cash-strapped diners who have been visiting its restaurants less frequently.

news.title: Trump says Netflix, WBD deal could be 'problem' as son-in-law Kushner backs Paramount bid
news.description: Trump's comments came days after Netflix beat out Paramount Skydance's offer for all of WBD, and Comcast's bid for part of the company.

news.title: United maintains elite status requirements for 2027, but here's what's changing
news.description: Airlines have spent years grappling with having hordes of members in elite frequent flyer programs.

news.title: Home sellers are giving up at 'unusually high rate,' says new Realtor report
news.description: Sellers are taking their homes off the market at the highest delisting rate since Realtor.com began tracking the seasonal trend in 2022.

news.title: Bessent says U.S. will finish the year with 3% GDP growth, sees 'very strong' holiday season
news.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the economy will end the year on strong footing and said the president was disappointed in economic coverage in the media.

news.title: Core inflation rate watched by Fed hit 2.8%, delayed September data shows, lower than expected
news.description: The delayed core personal consumption expenditures price index for September was expected to show a 2.9% annual increase.

news.title: Layoff announcements top 1.1 million this year, the most since 2020 pandemic, Challenger says
news.description: The firm said layoff plans totaled  71,321 in November, a step down from October but still enough to bring the 2025 total up to 1.17 million.

news.title: Ukraine, trade, pandas: What China's Xi and France's Macron discussed in Beijing
news.description: China said it is open to importing more high-quality goods from France while urging a "fair, conducive environment" for Chinese businesses in the European nation.

news.title: Bessent says Trump admin will be able to replicate tariffs even if it loses Supreme Court decision
news.description: The Treasury secretary cited several sections of 1962 Trade Act that give the president sweeping powers over import duties.

news.title: November private payrolls unexpectedly fell by 32,000, led by steep small business job cuts, ADP reports
news.description: The payrolls decline marked a sharp step down from October, which saw an upwardly revised gain of 47,000 positions.

news.title: Waymo crosses 450,000 weekly paid rides as Alphabet robotaxi unit widens lead on Tesla
news.description: This year, Waymo debuted on freeways in three cities, and started autonomous driving in cities including Miami, Dallas, Houston, San Antonio and Orlando.

news.title: Apple's chip boss squashes exit rumors, says he's not leaving the company
news.description: Bloomberg reported on Saturday that Srouji had told CEO Tim Cook that he was considering leaving.

news.title: Tiger Global launches new fund eyeing $2.2 billion raise as it takes more disciplined approach
news.description: Tiger first invested in OpenAI in 2021 at a valuation of less than $16 billion and in Waymo that same year at $39 billion.

news.title: S&P 500 win streak, Berkshire's leadership changes, Netflix's regulatory path and more in Morning Squawk
news.description: Here are five key things investors need to know to start the trading day.

news.title: Confluent stock soars 29% as IBM announces $11 billion acquisition deal
news.description: IBM will pay $31 per share in cash for all of the issued and outstanding common shares of the Confluent.

news.title: Supreme Court conservatives poised to back Trump in FTC firing case
news.description: The justices heard arguments in the DOJ's appeal of a lower court's decision that Trump exceeded his authority when he moved to dismiss FTC member Rebecca Slaughter.

news.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says he has divested his soybean farm
news.description: The New York Times has reported that Secretary Bessent owned as much as $25 million of soybean and corn farmland in North Dakota.
